alert.note: Alert for Charles City; City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; City of Williamsburg; James City; New Kent; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:55PM EST until January 10 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHARLES CITY, SOUTHEASTERN NEW KENT, JAMES CITY AND YORK COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF HAMPTON, THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS, THE CITY OF POQUOSON AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG... At 955 PM EST, Light rain continues across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding impacts will continue, but little to no additional rainfall is expected. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Williamsburg, Queens Lake, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, College Of William And Mary, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Christopher Newport University, Norge, Toano, Langley AFB, Hampton University, Northampton, Grove, Busch Gardens, Carver Gardens, Lee Hall and York Terrace. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; City of Williamsburg; James City; New Kent; York
